1.segment: Background and aims The measurement of the skinfold thickness at various sites with the calipers has remained the traditional method for estimation of body fat percentage ( % BF ) in clinical practice .

2.segment: Although this technique is relatively inexpensive and easy to learn ,

3.segment: there are more chances of errors while measuring the skinfold thickness by this method .

4.segment: Therefore , no single standard prediction formula for the determination of body fat could be fixed .

5.segment: The aim of our study was to use B-mode ultrasound ( US ) for measuring the subcutaneous fat thickness and the calipers for skinfold thickness ,

7.segment: and derive the prediction equations for estimation of % BF by both the techniques .

9.segment: monocentric study was conducted on 43 Indian male volunteers aged 18 to 40 years .

10.segment: After collecting anthropometric data ( age , height , weight , body mass index , waist circumference , hip circumference , waist-to-hip ratio ( WHR ) ,

11.segment: etc. ) , the skinfold thickness was measured at four standard sites ( biceps , triceps , subscapular region , and suprailiac region ) with skinfold caliper ( SFC ) and then B-mode US .

12.segment: The data were analyzed for distribution ,

13.segment: and independent t-test was applied to compare the difference between two means of a % BF estimated by both the methods .

14.segment: The prediction equations were developed from anthropometric and skinfold thickness data obtained from both the methods ,

16.segment: by applying stepwise multiple linear regression .

17.segment: Results It was observed that mean values of all the skinfold thicknesses along with the % BF measured by SFC were far more than those measured by US .

18.segment: The % BF measured by US technique ( % BF US ) was significantly lesser ,

20.segment: than that of the SFC method ( % BF SFC ) ,

23.segment: The best prediction equation for the % BF by SFC method was ( % BF SFC = -26.154 + 0.208 SFss + 0.374 age + 0.354 SFbi + 32.066 WHR ) ( R ( 2 ) = 84.8 ) ,

24.segment: where SFss and SFbi are skin fold thicknesses at subscapular and biceps regions ,

26.segment: and that by the US method was ( % BF US = 0.713 + 0.351 USsi + 0.232 age + 0.248 USss + 0.448 USbi ) ( R ( 2 ) = 84.6 ) ,

27.segment: where USsi and USss are skinfold measurements at suprailiac and subscapular regions ,

29.segment: Conclusion In our study , we arrived to the conclusion that even though the estimated % BF by both the methods were found to have a significant correlation with each other ,

30.segment: the values were very less in case of the US method .

31.segment: In the prediction equations , it was found that the skinfold thickness at the suprailiac region was not found to be the significant determining factor for estimation of % BF by SFC method as that by the US method .

32.segment: Looking at the lesser sample size with all participants being males ,

33.segment: we do not recommend the prediction equations to be used in clinical practice in spite of the high R ( 2 ) values .
